name: Live4Life
introduction: My first work as a UX|UI designer and Frontend. Design and prototyped one page web presentation about me. With horizontal navigation and mobile first designed.

name: We Living
introduction: Web and branding design for students coliving

name: About Me
introduction: My first work as a UX|UI designer and Frontend. Design and prototyped one page web presentation about me. With horizontal navigation and mobile first designed.
goals: PERSONAL: one of my main objectives was to create something original and dynamic to give movement to the website as it had to be one page.
PROFESSIONAL: functional and visually attractive. Apply basic UX | UI rules, such as text construction, eye-catching headers, good colour palette,..
goal1: PERSONAL: one of my main objectives was to create something original and dynamic to give movement to the website as it had to be one page.
goal2: PROFESSIONAL: functional and visually attractive. Apply basic UX | UI rules, such as text construction, eye-catching headers, good colour palette.
bestPractices1: On desktop, the elements that can be clicked on, if user makes hover, it highlights colour
bestPractices2: In the menu, the section in which the user is located remains activated with a colour to highlight the location of where the user is.
bestPractices3: Simple navigation system, by means of a menu at the top on desktop
bestPractices4: The navigation menu on mobile devices is located at the bottom to facilitate the use of this, so the user makes less effort to reach each section and does not have to do it with both hands or extending the thumb, simply in the natural position in which he takes the mobile can navigate without difficulty.
bestPractices5: To create some atmosphere, dynamism and depth to the website I incorporated an animated background with gradients.
frontGoal: Learn about the functionality of horizontal scroll, programm on mobile first size, and have a good organisation in the structuring of the folders
bestPracticesF2: Responsive for: mobile, tablet and desktop
scss3: Use of variables, mixins, nested classes
js1: Labels on focus when user it’s on the selected section, that helps ubication.
js2: Functionality of the animated gradient. It actives in all the sections except in Home

ux.Goals: lear about the functionality of horizontal scroll, programm on mobile first size, and have a good organisation in the structuring of the folders.

Methodologies.Responsive: Responsive for: mobile, tablet and desktop

SCSS.variables: Use of variables for: colour, spacing, margins, texts..

JAVASCRIPT.labels: labels on focus when user it’s on the selected section, that helps ubication.
JAVASCRIPT.gradient: functionality of the animated gradient made with css:is activated in any section except the home page.

name: Terralava
introduction: Front-end design and programming of a dynamic and scalable website for a jewellery store. Sections created: Home, Shop with respective categories and an interactive test for users. Mobile first designed and programmed.
goal1: PERSONAL: One of my main objectives was to make a design that looks like a real online shop website. And learn about the architecture of online shop websites.
goal2: PROFESSIONAL: Make a design that looks like a real online shop website. Add interactivity and make the user's journey through the website fun. To do this I looked for a way to innovate and stand out from the competition's websites
bestPractices2: In the home section we find several calls to action to help the user to navigate
bestPractices3: In each section there are links that take you to other sections, in this way we do not leave any section without an exit
bestPractices4: Design made from atom design, that is, designing by components.
bestPractices5: Create a simple interactive quiz to make the user feel involved and important. Consisting of 7 questions, by answering a question, a smooth scroll took the user to the next one, which required minimum effort.  The results vary according to the option chosen for each question. In this way, we offer user support and innovate in the online jewellery retail market.
frontGoal: Move away from static programming. And learn how to dynamise content, using tools such as JavaScript and PHP
bestPracticesF2: Responsive for: mobile, tablet and desktop
scss3: Use of variables, mixins, nested classes
html1: Incorporation of elements such as the header and footer with a simple function
html2: Manipulation of paths to achieve shorter URLs, which is beneficial for SEO
js1: Create a JSON to store product information and request the information. In this way fill each section dynamically via Axios and Fetch. In this way for the shop section, a grid was created as a structure with scss and the images and data such as price, name of each jewel or description were filled in with JSON.
js2: Creation of an interactive test for users. By completing the test questions, results are displayed according to what has been selected. The answers were in an array, and the results were loaded via a path. In this way I learned a bit about paths.
js3: Learn to use online libraries to incorporate a swiper. At the same time learning the negative part of using them

projects.Goals: Move away from static programming. And learn how to dynamise content, using tools such as JavaScript and PHP

Methodologies.Responsive: Responsive for: mobile, tablet and desktop

SCSS.variables: Use of variables for: colour, spacing, margins, texts..

JAVASCRIPT.labels: labels on focus when user it’s on the selected section, that helps ubication.
JAVASCRIPT.gradient: functionality of the animated gradient made with css:is activated in any section except the home page.

name: Ronda & Martínez Abogados
introduction: Ronda & Martínez is a law firm with more than 30 years of experience ubicated in Altea, Alicante. They needed an identity design. All the process is set out in a manual where all the rules and construction of the brand are included.
needs: Ronda y Martínez lacked any graphic representation, which made it very difficult for them to sponsor themselves and stand out from the rest of the lawyers in Altea. What they needed:
needs2: A logo that represented their personality and professionalism. The final result of the logo represents: stability, with a modern and elegant design playing with the sizes of the column width. Inspired by the greek columns as this is where the law comes from.
needs3: That their great track record and way of working would be reflected both visually and in writing.
needs4: To stand out from the rest of the law firms.
obj1: Create a visual identity manual reflecting the rules of graphic use, the formation of the logo, the chromatic palette representing the brand, the typography and incorrect uses of the brand elements.
obj2: Designs that could be used in everyday life. Stationery such as: letters, business cards, folders, invoices, etc.
needs-solved: Ronda y Martínez lacked any graphic representation, which made it very difficult for them to sponsor themselves and stand out from the rest of the lawyers in Altea. What they needed:

A logo that represented their personality and professionalism. The final result of the logo represents: stability, with a modern and elegant design playing with the sizes of the column width. Inspired by the greek columns as this is where the law comes from.
That their great track record and way of working would be reflected both visually and in writing.
To stand out from the rest of the law firms.
Objective: Create a visual identity manual reflecting the rules of graphic use, the formation of the logo, the chromatic palette representing the brand, the typography and incorrect uses of the brand elements.
Designs that could be used in everyday life. Stationery such as: letters, business cards, folders, invoices, etc

name: Almond Harmony
introduction: Almond Harmony is a handmade clothing shop with quality fabrics from India, Morocco and Turkey. The bright colours and the softness of their clothes are what makes them stand out.
needs: Almond Harmony needed a brand construction in its entirety with which to represent itself.
needs1: A logo construction was made with its variants, colour palettes, and typography uses.
needs2: Creation of naming, logotype and different applications such as fabric bags, packaging, cards, labels, candles,...
obj1: A fresh visual identity, with bright and harmonious colours to make the brand's target feel identified.
obj2: Represent the values of the brand in a visual way such as: 100% handmade and organic, quality fabrics, fresh and comfortable clothes.
needs-solved: Almond Harmony needed a brand construction in its entirety with which to represent itself.
A logo construction was made with its variants, colour palettes, and typography uses.
Creation of naming, logotype and different applications such as fabric bags, packaging, cards, labels, candles,...
Objective: A fresh visual identity, with bright and harmonious colours to make the brand's target feel identified.
Represent the values of the brand in a visual way such as: 100% handmade and organic, quality fabrics, fresh and comfortable clothes.

name: Signane Systme UMH
introduction: Development of the signage system for the University of Fine Arts in Altea. This method has been created with the aim of being a guidance and orientation tool for passers-by in the faculty, given the lack of a method to help locate the areas and services found in the university.
needs1: The campus has ten buildings of different disciplines, each with a minimum of two floors and a maximum of three. The centre also has a number of key services such as a secretary's office, concierge's office, reprographics and a cafeteria. And none of these places are identified and you don't know how to get anywhere because there is no signposting.
needs2: With the creation of such a system, the identity of the university is reinforced, as well as the quality of the service to users and, of course, it solves the problems of orientation in the space
needs3: Types of signanes created, identification, directional, directories and maps.
obj1: By means of a study of the space, the aim was to solve orientation problems as well as to take advantage of the spaciousness of the campus, its passageways and routes. Likewise, the elements that make up the architecture have been taken into account, creating signs that respect this aspect.
obj2: The design features propose a youthful aesthetic, differentiation and innovation. These aspects are dealt with through the material, format, colours and typography.
obj3: Through this system, the value of the campus, its personality and its quality are highlighted, creating a space that is pleasant to walk through.
obj4: Helping people to get to places without getting lost, or to find the best route to their destination. User experience is key in this project
needs-solved: The campus has ten buildings of different disciplines, each with a minimum of two floors and a maximum of three. The centre also has a number of key services such as a secretary's office, concierge's office, reprographics and a cafeteria. And none of these places are identified and you don't know how to get anywhere because there is no signposting.
With the creation of such a system, the identity of the university is reinforced, as well as the quality of the service to users and, of course, it solves the problems of orientation in the space.
Types of signanes created, identification, directional, directories and maps.
Objective: By means of a study of the space, the aim was to solve orientation problems as well as to take advantage of the spaciousness of the campus, its passageways and routes. Likewise, the elements that make up the architecture have been taken into account, creating signs that respect this aspect

The design features propose a youthful aesthetic, differentiation and innovation. These aspects are dealt with through the material, format, colours and typography. Through this system, the value of the campus, its personality and its quality are highlighted, creating a space that is pleasant to walk through.
Helping people to get to places without getting lost, or to find the best route to their destination. User experience is key in this project

name: Health Centre Almassera
introduction: A small piece of work done during my internship at Mediterrània Creativa. Branding assignment for a specific season. The nurses at the Almassera de Tonda hospital wanted a logo to represent themselves for the covid-19 vaccination season.
needs: Some graphic elements were designed to help reinforce the identity created:
needs1: A logo inspired by the colourful houses of the village
needs2: A supporting pattern for corporate elements
obj1: With a small commission for a simple logo to create a scalable identity. A colourful logo to convey joy and familiarity.
obj2: The elements that make up the logo can be reused to create graphic elements such as those shown in the images.
needs-solved: Some graphic elements were designed to help reinforce the identity created:
A logo inspired by the colourful houses of the village
A supporting pattern for corporate elements
Objective: With a small commission for a simple logo to create a scalable identity
A colourful logo to convey joy and familiarity.
The elements that make up the logo can be reused to create graphic elements such as those shown in the images
